gen

Class FirstStageProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • gen.FirstStageProcessor

  • public class FirstStageProcessor
extends Object
    This class implements the transition system for the first stage defined in the thesis; i.e., it handles MERGE, SWAP, DELETE and KEEP transitions. Methods of this class can be used both for training the maximum entropy model for the first stage (see FirstStageMaxentModel) and for actually processing AMR graphs during testing.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FirstStageProcessor(FirstStageMaxentModel firstStageMaxentModel)
      Creates a new processor for the first generation stage, using the given maximum entropy model.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void performGoldTransitionsFirstStage(List<Amr> trainingAmrs, List<Amr> devAmrs, AutoLoadParams params, String filename, boolean train)
      Performs the gold MERGE, SWAP, DELETE and KEEP transitions for a list of AMR graphs; this function may also be used for training the maximum entropy model maxentModel.
      void processFirstStage(Amr amr)
      Processes an AMR graph by applying all MERGE, SWAP, DELETE and KEEP transitions predicted by the maximum entropy model maxentModel.
      void processFirstStage(List<Amr> amrs)
      Processes a list of AMR graphs by applying all MERGE, SWAP, DELETE and KEEP transitions predicted by the maximum entropy model maxentModel.

    • Method Detail

      • performGoldTransitionsFirstStage

        public void performGoldTransitionsFirstStage(List<Amr> trainingAmrs,
                                             List<Amr> devAmrs,
                                             AutoLoadParams params,
                                             String filename,
                                             boolean train)
                                      throws IOException
        Performs the gold MERGE, SWAP, DELETE and KEEP transitions for a list of AMR graphs; this function may also be used for training the maximum entropy model maxentModel.
        Parameters:
        trainingAmrs - the AMR graphs for which gold transitions should be applied; if this function is used for training, this list should contain all training AMRs.
        devAmrs - another list of AMR graphs for which gold transitions should be applied; if this function is used for training, this list should contain all development AMRs. Otherwise, this list may simply be kept empty.
        params - AutoLoad parameters for training, see AutoLoadParams, may be null if no training should be performed.
        filename - the name of the file in which the trained classifier should be saved, may be null if no training should be performed.
        train - whether training should be performed using the determined gold transitions
        Throws:
        IOException - if something goes wrong with saving the trained classifier

      • processFirstStage

        public void processFirstStage(List<Amr> amrs)
        Processes a list of AMR graphs by applying all MERGE, SWAP, DELETE and KEEP transitions predicted by the maximum entropy model maxentModel. This function is used during testing; it implements the algorithm generateGreedy_restr as defined in the thesis.
        Parameters:
        amrs - the AMR graphs to process

      • processFirstStage

        public void processFirstStage(Amr amr)
        Processes an AMR graph by applying all MERGE, SWAP, DELETE and KEEP transitions predicted by the maximum entropy model maxentModel. This function is used during testing; it implements the algorithm generateGreedy_restr as defined in the thesis.
        Parameters:
        amr - the AMR graph to process
